statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Lewis, Hart give Marist 69-67 win over St. Peter's
article.headline: Lewis, Hart give Marist 69-67 win over St. Peter's
article.linkText: Lewis, Hart give Marist 69-67 win over St. Peter's
article.story: POUGHKEEPSIE, N.Y. -- Chavaughn Lewis scored 25 points and Khalid Hart scored the winning layup with 1.5 seconds left to give Marist a 69-67 win over St. Peter's on Friday night. St. Peter's erased a nine-point deficit in the last five minutes, tying the game at 67 on Desi Washington's free throws with nine seconds left. But Hart answered with an acrobatic layup and the Peacocks' long 3-pointer at the buzzer was off the mark. T.J. Curry had 13 points and Hart 12 for the Red Foxes (6-23, 5-14 Metro Atlantic). Washington had 20 points for the Peacocks (13-17, 7-12) and Marvin Dominique had 14 points and 10 rebounds. Lewis scored 20 points and Marist shot 64 percent (16 of 25), including 9 of 15 from 3-point range, to take a 43-25 lead at the half. St. Peter's, which shot 30 percent in the first half, made 16 of 30 shots in the second half.
